'Artemis Fowl' is a series of eight science fiction fantasy novels written by
Irish author Eoin Colfer, featuring the titular character, Artemis Fowl II. A
teenage criminal mastermind, Artemis captures a Fairy, Holly Short, in the first
book and holds her for ransom to exploit the magical Fairy People and restore
his family's fortune. In the sequel, [[Artemis Fowl: The Arctic Incident]], he
allies with the Fairies to rescue his father from the Russian Mafia. The series
introduces Artemis as an anti-hero and the fairies' enemy, but as the series
progresses, he assists the Fairies in resolving conflicts with worldwide
ramifications; Artemis develops a strong sense of morals, and by the final book,
he is willing to sacrifice his life for his friends. The series concluded with
[[Artemis Fowl: The Last Guardian]], released July 2012.

The series has received positive critical reception and generated huge sales. It
has also originated graphic novel adaptations, and a film adaptation is
currently in the writing process.
